Key Arguments: Concerns about who will determine what is true or false.
The legislation is likened to censorship in authoritarian regimes like China or North Korea.
Belief that Australians can discern information from misinformation without government intervention.
The legislation infringes on free speech and the right to express ideas without government interference.
The legislation poses a threat to future generations' freedoms.
Notable Quotes: What is proposed is what one would expect to be enforced in China or North Korea, not a supposedly democratic, free society.
Does our Government think that Australians are that stupid, that we cannot think for ourselves and discern what is information and what is misinformation?
Nobody in history that has ever tried to silence people has ever turned out to be the good guy.
